Thus, discrepancies which do not go to the root of the matter or to the core of a case and shake
the basic version of the witness cannot be given too much importance. Further, it has been held
that  a  court  must  consider  whether  the  discrepancy  was  due  to  dishonesty,  or  to  defective
memory or whether the witnesse's powers of observations were limited.
